json.text: hi this is Karl with another SOP video for managed service providers and I want
to take just a minute and talk about why we love the HP microserver line in
particular for our cloud services 5-pack that we've been selling since 2008 this
little baby has made us a lot of money
first of all this thing ships with xeon processor and it's a proliant which
means it's rock-solid it is built on the most solid computer technology server
technology available today so I know from experience that this machine is
going to last me as long as I'd like it too personally I need to last three or
four years
let's talk about why this is the right thing for the service that we're selling
so whatever you want to do this thing is going to be able to do it at the small
end of the space remember what we want to do with cloud services is I want
local active directory so I've got security on site i want really great
internet connectivity I want to be able to remotely manage it and I wanted to be
a performer to the extent that it needs to be for the most part you're gonna be
moving some files to and from the cloud so this can be your backup for your
cloud services and you're going to be authenticating logons you're not going
to be putting seven sequel databases on this thing
the ship's the way i bought it with eight gigs of ram it will go to a
maximum of 16 so for authenticating log on with a xeon processor you're going to
be just fine
it's got two gigabit network cards
it's got four USB tues and two USB threes there's another port for the I
low so if you want to do integrated lights-out you can give it an IP address
on the internet and you're going to be able to remotely get into this at the
console level and it's got a slot for a pci-e x16 card in case you decide that
that's what you need it comes standard with the BG
a output and again the way that I can figure this it's got for one terabyte
hard drives those are say to drive so they're spinning drives 7200 RPM this
machine could be sold to a client in the neighborhood of eight or nine hundred
dollars and you'll be making profit that personally i buy this machine I own it I
put it at the client site and we provided as a service we charge 200 and
depending on the client hundred and fifty dollars a month so this is going
to be paid for in nine or ten months and after that the next three years are
hundred percent profit the microserver also comes with a cd-rom drive for DVD
drive is standard and these drives can pop right out there not hot plug in this
case but they do slide right out so they're easy to replace
and because you've got four drives you can decide whether you want to mirror to
for the operating system and 24 the data or whether you want to have one is a hot
spare or just have it sitting there whatever you want to do so the HP
microserver does not come with a keyboard and mouse because it's intended
to be a headless server you'll have to provide those yourself temporarily but
it also comes with some nice things that you do expect from a server like an
integrated raid controller again all for the super low low price
this will load up just about any operating system you can imagine you can
get some of them pre-configured with an operating system already installed so
it's lightweight it's very very powerful for what it needs to do and i can
imagine this thing easily lasting for five years if that's what you want to
get out of it
I know of one that's been in operation for eight years pretty much since the
things were invented so I know it also lasts a long time if that you what you
wanted to do remember when all you're doing is authenticating logon and
sending people to the internet this is you could have this serve up dhcp if you
want you certainly want to have it serve up dns authenticate logons and then copy
files down from the internet that's really all it needs to do eight gigs of
ram and xeon processor will absolutely get the job done for you i love this
machine i've owned a lot of them have sold a lot of them this is what we build
our cloud 5-pack one for small biz stocks this is Karl Palachuk wishing you
